title: Support and display two phone numbers across homepage contact areas

requirements.summary: Extend central contact config to expose two phone numbers with correct display strings and tel links (keeping backward compatibility).
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/config/contact.ts` contains both phone numbers in a structured form usable by multiple components (e.g., a list/array plus any backward-compatible fields if needed).
The stored display strings match exactly: "+91 7734920728" and "+91 7297963005".
The stored `tel:` links correctly map to `tel:+917734920728` and `tel:+917297963005`.

file_operations.description: Update CONTACT_INFO to include a structured phone list (e.g., `phones: [{display,tel}, ...]`) containing exactly "+91 7734920728" (tel:+917734920728) and "+91 7297963005" (tel:+917297963005). Preserve backward compatibility by keeping/deriving existing `CONTACT_INFO.phone` fields as the primary/first number so existing CTAs keep working deterministically.

requirements.summary: Render both phone numbers as clickable tel links anywhere the homepage shows a phone number (top bar, footer, contact section contact-info).
acceptanceCriteria: Top bar shows both phone numbers and each is clickable to dial via `tel:`.
Footer contact area shows both phone numbers and each is clickable to dial via `tel:`.
Contact section contact-info block shows both phone numbers and each is clickable to dial via `tel:`.
No phone number currently shown on the homepage remains as a single-number-only rendering (unless it is intentionally WhatsApp-only).

file_operations.description: Create a small reusable renderer that consumes `CONTACT_INFO.phones` and displays both numbers as clickable `tel:` links with consistent formatting/separators for reuse in TopBar, Footer, and ContactSection.
Replace the single phone rendering with the reusable PhoneNumberLinks component (or equivalent map over `CONTACT_INFO.phones`) so the top bar shows both phone numbers as `tel:` links.
Update the Contact list to render both phone numbers (clickable `tel:` links) from `CONTACT_INFO.phones` instead of a single `CONTACT_INFO.phone` value.
Update the contact-info block to render both phone numbers as clickable `tel:` links (using `CONTACT_INFO.phones`/PhoneNumberLinks), while keeping WhatsApp link behavior as WhatsApp-only.

requirements.summary: Keep all phone-call CTAs working with deterministic behavior by targeting the primary/first phone number and avoiding broken links/TS errors.
acceptanceCriteria: The "Call Now" button in the header navigation works and opens a `tel:` link for a valid phone number.
The "Call Now" button in the contact section works and opens a `tel:` link for a valid phone number.
No TypeScript errors are introduced by the contact config change (project builds successfully).

file_operations.description: Ensure CallNowButton continues to use a deterministic primary phone `tel:` (e.g., `CONTACT_INFO.phone.tel` derived from the first entry in `CONTACT_INFO.phones`) so the header navigation "Call Now" remains valid after adding the second number.
Ensure the contact section "Call Now" CTA continues to link to the deterministic primary phone `tel:` (the first number), independent of how the two-number display is rendered.
